title: Two Moving Objects Distance
description: Interactive visualization examining how the rate of distance change between two moving objects depends on their positions and velocities
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Calculus
Related Rates
Derivatives
learningObjectives: Examine how the rate of distance change between two moving objects depends on their positions and velocities
Apply the related rates formula for distance between two objects
Investigate how direction changes affect the rate of distance change

controls.name: speedASlider
controls.label: Car A Speed
controls.description: Speed of Car A in mph

controls.name: speedBSlider
controls.label: Car B Speed
controls.description: Speed of Car B in mph

controls.name: directionA
controls.label: Car A Direction
controls.description: Direction of Car A (North or South)

controls.name: directionB
controls.label: Car B Direction
controls.description: Direction of Car B (East or West)

variables: a - distance of Car A from origin (miles)
b - distance of Car B from origin (miles)
da/dt - rate of change of a (mph)
db/dt - rate of change of b (mph)
dd/dt - rate of change of distance (mph)
assumptions: Both cars start at the origin at t=0
Cars travel in straight lines along perpendicular roads
